wordpressPost.title: WeSpire Survey: The State of Employee Sustainability Engagement
wordpressPost.content:
We’re a curious bunch here at WeSpire. Specifically, we’d like to better understand the current level of employee engagement and support for sustainability within organizations. So we’re conducting an employee engagement survey to provide us with some facts. And we need your help.
It’s a brief survey ‘ seriously. It should only take 5 minutes to complete:
https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/EmplEngagementSurvey2014
In order to provide insights and trending information, we hope to reach as many participants as possible. We ask that you please share the survey with your network. It will be open until May 9, 2014.
Brighter Planet, a leader in sustainability technology and research from 2005 to 2013, conducted the same study in 2009 and 2011. In their research, Brighter Planet found that organizations are increasingly engaging their employees on sustainability: over 50% of organizations promote sustainability frequently or very frequently, a 5% increase from the first year the study was conducted. They have generously handed us the reins to enable a third iteration of the research, and with it five years total of trending data.
Below is a glimpse of the data collected in the 2011 report:

In addition to positive indicators, this research will identify barriers, thus providing direction to organizations looking to overcome the toughest workplace challenges. We are excited to not only collect and analyze the results, but also to share the results with you so together we can help build a more engaged and sustainable work environment.
So, please help us enrich the data by sharing the survey link with your employees, colleagues and broader network.
Thanks!

[UPDATE: As of May 2014, this employee engagement survey has been closed. However, to see the results of our survey, read our research report!]
